subject: p17032538
Impression: AP chest compared to at 4:33 am. And 1:08 pm: New endotracheal tube in standard placement. Edema in the left lung appears less radiodense but this may be a function of better inflation following tracheal intubation. Severe right lung scarring and concurrent emphysema make it difficult to determine if a concurrent pneumonia is present. Heart size is normal. Right pleural thickening is more pronounced now than it was in suggesting either a component of pleural effusion or pathologic pleural involvement.
